laboratory_examinations.findings: Hemoglobin on admission was 56 g/L (normal range 138–172 g/dL).
PT was prolonged at 190.2 s (normal range 11–13.5 s).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: PT showed correction in mixing studies with pooled plasma.

laboratory_examinations.findings: aPTT was prolonged at 144.9 s (normal range 21–35 s).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: aPTT showed correction in mixing studies with pooled plasma.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Fibrin degradation product was 3.1 mg/L (normal <10 mg/L).
Fibrinogen level was increased to 5.6 g/L (normal range 2.0–4.0 g/L).
Markedly reduced factor X levels to 4.7%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Factor X levels steadily improved to normalcy over three months.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Bethesda factor X inhibitor titer assay
laboratory_examinations.findings: The Bethesda factor X inhibitor titer assay was negative.
